Still, after this lady brought us our coffee & tea, our dirty plates and glasses and silverware were still on the table which made our table look like a mess.  When I wanted to make my tea I notice that there was barely any hot water in the little tea kettle and that it was very dirty inside.  I asked for new tea kettle that is actually filled with hot water. When I got my new hot water I made my tea and when I finished pouring water in my tea cup I saw the exactly same amount of water that was left in the tea kettle as I got it with the first one: no doubt they just grabbed a previous guest's tea kettle and gave it to me!  I will never go back to this place an wouldn't recommend it to my friends and fellow travelers.

Gave this place one more try after receiving feedback from last review and it was worse, not better. Washrooms atrocious (both men's and women's and service deplorable. Sorry because your food is delicious. Need to work on service and housekeeping.

A trusted place to dine.  After our horrible experience with Buca San Francisco of not seating us on time for our reservation, we walked over to CPK and was greeted/welcomed with a readily accommodating seating = awesome!  No reservations needed.  Vegas (host) took us in and created space to accommodate our party. We were so hungry due to the wait at Buca that I only had two pictures of what we ordered: Roasted Artichoke Spinach Pizza on hand tossed crust and Chicken Waldorf Salad = both were YUM! Would've easily gave 5 stars but our server was so-so attentive.  Maybe that's because we had a big party???  But considering CPK was our rebound restaurant, it did great for our needs.

My group arrived around the lunch hour on a Saturday and I immediately had flashbacks to an old episode of "South Park," specifically Chef singing, "...and you wait and you wait and you wait and you wait..." *beat* "...and you wait and you wait and you wait." The sign at the front requested that we wait to be seated. There were a few other people in the restaurant who were eating or in the process of ordering, so clearly we hadn't arrived outside of business hours. We waited. I watched employees pass near us a few times, all seeming careful to avoid eye contact. Finally, the person who was ahead of us - and whom I thought had already been helped - piped up, "Is there anybody seating people?" We were seated not long after, and the service from that point was punctual. The food was consistent with other CPKs that I've visited. Whether you're getting a pizza, sandwich, or just soup, it's all tasty. Had it not been for the long delay in being seated and the faint but lingering smell of urine rising from the floors, I would have rated this a solid three stars.
Good food but the service speed tonight was horrid!  Not sure what the issues were but long wait before we even got out drink order in was the correct indicator of how the night would go.

The worst customer service we ever experienced! It was my sons 5 th birthday so we decided to take him for a boat ride to san francisco and his favorite dinner pizza, so we choose cpk, we regret not going to our usual celeberation place cheesecake factory, we were seated immediately as there was no waiting and the server came, took our order and asked we want want any coke( none of the other drink she offered) and since we were very tired and hungry we directly ordered main course! My son loves the bread they serve but unfortunately they choose not to serve us! All the other  tables were served! The pizza was served cold so we told the server and she got it re-heated and hard crust.. We did not want to spoil our celeberation so we choose to ignore it.. We did not even finish the pizza and the server put the bill on the table and asked us if we need any boxes! We took the boxes and left! Do you give this kind of service? Dont you ask if u want any deserts? We left on my sons 5 th birthday without a desert!! Please get your staff trained if needed take help from cheesecake factory staff for training.. Never going to any CPK ever!

We got three pizza, the carnitas, the works and the roasted garlic chicken pizza. My favourite was the roasted garlic chicken pizza, it was delicious, had a good amount of toppings and was great combination of onions, chicken, garlic and cheese. In general, all the pizza were fairly good. Service was kind of slow even though there weren't a lot of people, so that was the only downside. I recommend this place to people who want a decently priced savoury pizza place.

Food was good but service was horrible. Server by the name of Daniel was super rude. I came in with a big party and was seated immediately by another staff member. We were all respectful and polite customers but this guy was rude and constantly gave attitude. Probably one of the worst customer service experience I've had. Would have only gave 1 star for bad customer service; the second star was for the food.

Just left this location and the manager is the worst. One of the most unprofessional members of management I have ever had to deal  with. Fist he's on his phone behind the host both and he noticed us 5min later,    Food was ok server was ok , but to many tables for him never got a refill , after I asked for the Check and try to pay , the waiter says sorry sir its declined ... (I'm from out of town ) so I called my bank and they said no sir u should be ok. Looks like they typed in wrong info and should only slide card. Have them run it again my bank says.        2 mins later the manager comes back and say all good went through. Then looks at the check and he made a mistake. He charged someone else's bill to my card so he goes back refunds it and tried to charge me and he tells me my card is declined. Not once did he apologize for the long wait or the mistake his employee made by typing in info instead of sliding the card. Not once did he apologize for his mistake charging my card. Ended up paying cash but no one should ever go through this . I as a manager would have apologized and maybe applied a discount or wave the whole bill for his mistake and his employee. Worst experience ever !!!
NOM nom. The place is roomy with lots of tables. The food came out really fast and the servers were super nice.

Let me start by saying the food is surprisingly good.The staff seem like they would rather be some place else. The bartender while nice enough looked like he just woke up from last night's party,the manager was eating at the bar,and the host well just didn't care. Luckily the food saved the day.Will i go back sure why not wasn't that bad.

Eating here is great, and I will come in to eat pretty frequently because I work around the corner, but the take out portions are astronomically smaller (esp with a Salad) - never again am I ordering a $16 salad and getting it for take out - such a rip off!
Can't go wrong at CPK when you want Cheesecake Factory Type food without the 1 hour wait. This location is usually pretty empty in the evening as all of the Financial District dies at 6pm.

I came here for my 22nd birthday lunch, we had a group of 10 People and our server was not happy about that. He gave us some of the worst service I've ever experienced. He wouldn't tell us his name, but was had slick purple hair, with darker toned skin. Bad service is enough but even on my birthday... He was so rude and didn't even really care to Help us out wth drinks and didn't care when our orders where messed up. Sorry for being an in convince to your job on my birthday purple haired waiter...  never again
The Thai chicken salad is very good. The pasta was average. The spring rolls were average. Pizza is also good. Nice place to have a casual lunch.

Surprised to see such mixed reviews on this place. Having a conference for work back in early October led me to a location pretty much across the street from this place. I was with my co-workers on an hour and a half lunch break and one pitched the idea of pizza. I saw the California Pizza Kitchen and I was a bit skeptical at first. My skepticism was based around the fact that the town I live in (Stockton, CA) had a CPK near the Mall for only a brief time before it went under. I hadn't eaten at the location when it was in town but had automatically assumed that it wasn't any good. Also, when you look at a Brand that pushes out Frozen Pizzas (see -  ), you start thinking the real deal is going to be as weak as the Frozen Pizza. I should've known better.  We sit down with about a party of 10 total and we're immediately greeted and have our drink orders taken. It was pretty dead inside for a Monday afternoon around lunch time. I noticed a couple people walk in and one of the employees knew them (as if they were regulars there). With it being pretty quiet inside with only a handful of parties, I started gauging the employee culture. I heard the bartender cracking jokes with a server, and every employee had what looked like to be a genuine smile on their faces. There was a sincere personable vibe among the staff on how they were treating the customers. It came off as if every person walking in the door was a regular.  We waited a bit for the food to come out (necessary with a party of 8). The wait wasn't too bad. The food was cooked to perfection. It's like everything came off the oven at the same time. My pizza was hot, it had more of a soft texture to the dough instead of a crispy texture, but the pie still had the golden brown look to it. Our waiter was very attentive and offered us refills to go. Overall we had a fantastic time and the food was really good. The conference was a multi-day event and I ended up eating here again the following day. Wish there was one in my town that did as well. I know Pizza is a hard business to be in. Look at all of the chains out there, along with the non chain businesses, you can pretty much find pizza anywhere every couple of blocks in San Francisco. Next time I come to town and I'm in the area, I'll be stopping by. Expect me.

My friends and I came here for a birthday party, and had the worst experience ever. The waiter was very rude, he took over 30 Minutes to come back to our table to take our order down. Mind you, the place was not even that busy. He never once came back to our table to ask how we were doing when our food came out, and never asked if we needed refills on drinks. He kept on avoiding our table for some reason, and we finally got a hold of the manager who gave us refills, but again, did not come back to check on us. We finally flagged the waiter down so we could pay, and we left. This is the second time we have had a horrible service, we thought it was just the waiter with purple hair who was bad, but the overall service of the establishment is horrendous.

Have Ryan as your server! He's the best and went out of his way for my boyfriend. We are from SoCal and we are used to the changes they made to their menu (I.e. California roots beverage). Ryan went out of his way to google what was in the drink so he could make it for us. He has great hospitality and worked so hard as a server! The best we've come across in the restaurant business here in the bay. And when they do change their menu with the updated beverages and desserts, it will not disappoint. Thank you Ryan for your hard work as working as a bartender and having a whole section to yourself. We will definitely come back and request you!
This has always been one of my favorite restaurant chains. I'v been going there for over  15 years and there isn't much that I don't like on the menu. I highly recommend CPK to everyone.

Pizza and appetizer ordered was good, and taste of the food should always be the same no matter which venue you visit in CA.  After a few days of Asian fare, pizza sounded pretty good and it's located right across from our hotel.  I think the food would have tasted even better if the service had been similar.  Our waiter was not rude but it did take a while before our water arrived and our order placed.  Likewise, the host and hostess (two kids) seemed a bit lost as to where to place us (only two people), and there were plenty of tables opened.  It was not super busy - maybe 45% capacity full.  This place offers good, solid pizzas but it does not run as smoothly as the venues in socal.  I think once they have the right staff in place, this establishment could do wonders.

First off, let me talk about the purple haired waiter, Daniel. Upon first sitting down and having him wait on us, I instantly felt like I was bothering him. It only got worse. My friend and I decided to split a pizza and salad, but we were with a table of 5. As soon as us two were done ordering, he assumed that was all we wanted and closed his book and walk away. We had to stop him and tell him we wanted more than just that, and when we told him he rolled his eyes and opened his book again with attitude as if it was our fault that we came here for food. After getting our food, our table was avoided and we had to flag him down for water. Along with giving us rude looks and attitude with every question we had, it only got worse when we got the check. We knew we would have a problem when asking for three seperate checks. Our friend accidentally misscounted 72 cents short while paying, and he had the audacity to rudely drop the bill back onto the table and say "Not enough money. Also keep in mind the tip isn't included." With a thumbs up. I know I will not ever be visiting this CPK again while in the city, the only reason I gave two stars was because their pizza is great.

I came here for lunch to celebrate my brother and sister's birthdays.  We had the most wonderful service and the food was very good.  Our waiter/bartender and the manager were attentive and just terrific.  They went out of their way to make sure my gift card was honored and brought the little birthday sundaes without the birthday song as requested by my brother.  Thanks, gentlemen!  I was there in November with friends for my own birthday lunch.  It's kind of getting to be our go to birthday place and it's a sweet treat...

This place is reasonable. However. The service is below par. Ordered drinks in a half empty place and it took ready for this? 25 minutes! Asked if he could bring water and he says they are not allowed to offer water! Are people just plain old not thinking? They also saud that a high chair us a fire hazard in booths! Wt? Anyway you get what you pay for. For superbowl week this place aint ready!

Had an awesome time tonight! So the bf and I decided to have a spontaneous dinner date tonight, and so we came to CPK. Bf was running late, so when I went in to get a table, the host was really sweet. He seated me right away too. I signed up for this email thing where if I check in on their app every time I eat, I can earn free stuff over time.  Eric, our waiter, was very kind and he checked in several times during our meal to make sure the food was good. Thanks for the great service!! Also, the food was awesome  My bf and I each always order the white pizza (no bacon). We're too picky to try anything else and share the white pizza together! So we just both order the same thing!

I love cpk. So when I saw it across from our hotel I was very happy. Unfortunately I was very disappointed with the service. From the beginning our server never brought us napkins or utensils. He noticed that and promised to do that. When our food arrived, we again asked for napkins and utensils. We never got anything. I pulled napkins I had in my jacket and we ate pizza with our hands. Server never noticed nor cared that were using our own napkins, he only came back to our table when he saw we stood up to leave, other than that he would walk by many times not looking at us, I tried to get his attention with no luck .

Complete garbage. I ordered carry out and the service and food was crap. The waiter at the take out desk initially started to bag my order when I arrived, then stopped what she was doing to pull another order for another walk-in who I assumed was a customer but then looked to be a fellow employee. THEN she takes a call for 10min (I timed it) and by the time she get back to bagging my order the pizza is already cold, and she forgets the bread and oil. Okay so that can be forgiven. I get back and open the package and the pizza is rock hard and disgusting. I ordered a California Veggie and they forgot the veggie part. The kids pizza was over loaded with pepperoni to the point my kid refused to finish a slice. All in all if I had more time to spend in the city I would have gone back and addressed the issue to management. However, being in the location they're in, management should know better. Big fail for this location.

Horrible service. Takes forever for something to get done. The waiter keeps on walking off and never comes back. Can't get the check or place an order. Seems like we get attitude for questions. I hope management really sees this issues and retrain. There should definitely be more customer service representatives to help out people. The two gentlemen sitting next to us didn't get helped for a while and they simply just left.

Worst services ever. Never come back again. The server in the picture is not serving the females and Asian here. Don't come here. I would never come here. Plz don't support the business here. The server in the picture yelled at me. He thinks he is the boss. However, only the guy in the picture has such bad attitude. If anyone comes here, please never use this server!

So I am new here in town and wanted a nice pizza to eat. The name says it all!!  When I entered I got a nice spot in a corner, perfect for me to eat alone and to sit back and relax. The waiter was very very friendly! I got my cherry coke (so nice they have it here) and a California pizza. It tasted perfect.  One thing I noticed.. Staff were walking around but also sitting at tables. I even saw a chef walking around in the restaurant with his phone.. Ehm.. Is it just me or is this normal?  So a nice place to eat a real quick pasta, soup or pizza with the family

We have been to this place a couple of times for lunch. CPK is there in India as well and they serve some amazing pizzas. Over here, they live up to the reputation (or perhaps the other way round).  Food: We've tried California Veggie and Shaved Mushroom Spinach lunch duo along with Grilled Veggie half sandwich and Super Spinach Quinoa salad. The food was good overall. Especially, we loved the super spinach quinoa salad. Great in taste and well balanced in terms of sweetness of apples and acidity of champagne vinaigrette. Pizza were good but not so great compared to what we had in India. Ambiance: It is quite a spacious place and adequate lighting. Being a chain, they tend to maintain similar arrangement everywhere. It is one of the places where you can go for fine dine.  Service: Service was quite good and quick. The staff was well behaved. Nothing exceptional but they were good.  Overall, it's a nice place to be.

So.... This CPK does not impress me at all. So i ordered to go over the phone. I arrived at CPK 30 mins later and my order was not ready. So what's the point in me putting my order in advance if i still had to wait. My order was simple a large pizza and mac n cheese and a strawberry lemonade drink. They handed me the cup and it was sticky, like really wipe the cup down before you give it to your customer. Then they handed the pizza to me "here you go". I would recommend not coming to this CPK and going to other ones.

My waiter was really nice and super sweet. Ye place is dirty and grungy. I was in a booth and the seats were stained and warped. I ordered the dumpling appetizers.  They tasted bland, rubbery in texture, and tasted old (perhaps frozen). The potato soup was good, great texture, good flavor, tho a but salty. Just kinda a sad dinner :( especially amongst all the good eat choices in the area. Other CPKs have always been such a yummy experience. So I was super sad. Will not be returning.

I would give them 0 stars if I could! My order for a flat bread and a bowl of soup took half an hour to come to my table on a regular Thursday night, without even a simple apology for the long wait. You would expect the manager to make up for it but he was pretty relaxed with the idea of an annoyed customer leaving! No surprise that I left without eating or paying for the food! First and last time there ever!

Just went here with my friend for dinner. We called before to ask if they validate parking and the host informed me that they did, and I asked for specifics of which structure to park in, and he said the parking structure across. I started describing what I was looking at saying is the parking structure sign black? And he said yes. After dinner we were informed that we parked in the wrong structure and that there was nothing they could do about it. If I hadn't called before to clarify I wouldn't have called the manager over. When the manager came over, he sat down right next to my friend and immediately got defensive. He said 'maybe ' it was our fault, but probably not. I said no it was. It's important that whoever is answering the phone knows where and what to say. I have never been treated so rudely. He proceeded to say next time park in MY parking structure and then I'll help you, acted as if it was almost comical that we messed up the parking, laughed in our faces and lastly got in mine. He left and came back with three dollars and said it was the best he could do. I told him that I used to work at a CPK and NEVER could I see a manager that I worked with acting in such a disrespectful manner. OVER PARKING. He walked away laughing when the conversation finished.

Love this place. Food is always good and service is always good. I highly recommend for all pizza lovers. If you're lucky enough hopefully you will have Cynthia as your server or bartender, she gives off a great vibe and very  knowledgeable about her job.
We had to wait a hour for our food, it was mediocre at best.  And the service, what service... The waiter took our order and later brought the check. That was about it.  We won't be back.
Been here many times. Never let me down before. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine is my favorite and Pesto Cream Penne. This time we tried steak and salad. Omg!! Everything is ON Point! Yum Yum Yum.
I love their menu and their food in general... but if our server is feisty, doesn't smile, non-kid friendly... it ruins our appetite! Not sure if this branch gets visited frequently by families...

I would give no stars if I could. I never experienced horrible service like that. From our waiter and the restaurant manager when we asked for his attention. We've waited 25 min before anybody even came to us. We finally order after the waiter took our 8ppl order in two parts after he had to go talk to 2 chick's at the table next to us while he's putting out order on hold and go to talk to this girls.  After we called the manager he came and said ohh your waiter is right here. We let it go because we Was super hungry and tiered. We just want to go home. We finally ordered. The food come after 30min. Cold like it's been out for long time. 2 dishes was missing. And we had to wait moor to get the right order again. It was a nightmare to see the disrespect to customers

Went in to seat 3. Restaurant had less than half full. We stood at reception for 10 minutes before being greeted with a person who said it would be at least 10 more minutes before we could be seated. Sorry, limited time for lunch - especially when you can't even be acknowledged for being a customer.

It's best to come when it's not too busy they have the tv turned on my grilled chicken ceaser salad was great. However my friend ordered the CoBb salad and they kept messing up her salad she asked three times for no blue cheese and everytime it comes out from the kitchen they still are placing it on her salad. One of the hostess tried to make up for the mistake however she got the salad the third time and mind you it was going to be free since they messed up the order two times the third time it was the same " no blue cheese " how are they messing this order up smh

Sorry not sorry, CPK is delicious!  I'm the Whole Foods, kale salad type but sometimes you just need some chain pizza to hit the spot.  This location is huge, you never have to wait for a table during lunch. The service is spot on and I like all the different types of seating. Booths! Large long tables! Banquettes! They got you. We even came here with a little baby plus stroller and they sat us perfectly at a table with plenty of room.  I always have my girlfriend that loves CPK order. She is the expert! Today we had Thai pizza (so culturally wrong but tastes so right!) and the Italian chopped salad. Add salami and it's an Italian dish at CPK. We also had giant diet cokes and they hit the spot.  It looks like they're pushing all kinds of new cocktails, wine cocktails, flights...I like your style CPK and next time I'm having a bad day you'll be my first stop to get day drunk!

The food was really good. We ordered pizza and 2 different kind of padta and we really enjoyed it. The service was nice. We didnt have to wait long for the food which was great. The prices are reasonable

The food at CPK is generally good and pretty standard as it is a chain restaurant. At this location, the same dish on different days tastes different--case in point: Spicy chicken Chipotle pizza. The front desk and the take out counter are not on the same page. There seems to be a lack of communication among staff. Sometimes they choose to give you bread, sometimes they choose not to. In my opinion the service at this location can be a hit or miss...
I tried their chain in LA and service and food was much better. Food quality was mediocre and service was worst! So dissappointed

Once again, my best friend and I were burdened with the task of finding dinner in San Francisco, a city that is a melting pot of unique cuisine. The first place we found had a 45-minute wait that we just could not do. The second place we looked at was over $30.00 a plate, which was out of our budget tonight. Right before settling on Denny's, Mel's, or god forbid, McDonald's, we came across CPK.  I love the California Pizza Kitchen, and she has never been, so this was the perfect place to be. The place was pretty empty, but there was also no host at the front. Instead, the bartender ALL the way in the back made his way to the front just to seat us. We were seated right next to the exit, which on a very cold and rainy night, was not ideal. Every time the door opened, we were hit with frigid air.  We were hungry so we knew we wanted an appetizer; however, we did not want to spend $12.00 on one, so we went with the hummus starter. The plate comes with six pieces of flat bread, and a small dish of hummus topped with slice tomatoes in the middle. Both the bread and hummus was good, and definitely worth the price.  We ordered the The Works with no black olives. The pizza came out, and it looked beautiful. Not Victoria's Secret beautiful, but more like Picasso beautiful; it's unperfect and unique. It's all about the flavors though, and the flavor train was definitely present. The best part of the pie for me was the sausage. The sausage alone carries so much of the flavor that I could just eat that alone.  We ordered dessert, and like the appetizers we went for the cheapest one possible. It was a salted caramel pudding, with homemade whipped cream, and a cookie crust on the bottom. The whole thing was served in a little jar. It was small, tasted delicious, and in another word: Perfect.  The friendliest waiter of the evening wasn't even our waiter. His name is Jon, and he started a conversation with us because of our Nightmare before Christmas attire. He was incredibly sweet, fun, and I'm kind of sad he wasn't our waiter. Our waiter was fine though, and the manager of the place had a bit of a weird vibe to him. He took our check with money and we thought he was going to close us out. Instead, he hands the check to our waiter, who was just about to take care of another table. So, there was not point to what he did.  On the check there is an extra fee about a SF health care tax, or something like that. It's not a huge amount, however, it wasn't very pleasant to see either.

Kudos go out to our local California Pizza Kitchen, or CPK if you prefer.  For those who don't know, CPK is a kitchen that serves pizza. That doesn't keep them though for trying new things. Case in point, they went out on a limb and tried their hand at pasta; specifically Mac & Cheese tonight.  Now, normally Mac & Cheese is a dish best made by a college student on a budget completely out of their mind on a cocktail of weed from last night and caffiene as part of studying for exams tomorrow.  Of course one can't hold CPK to those impossibly high standards, and they did a fine job. They only misunderstood that they needed to cook the mac and cheese, or that it's best served hot (or at least warm). They also tried cooking other pasta- a pesto penne. Sure they misunderstood the italian term al dente to mean "hard, crunchy pasta served cold", but cooking non-pizza is hard! Not to half-way do anything, they are also experimenting with serving liquor.  I appreciated our server's dedication to learning how to serve liquor and how to pour fluids from one container into a glass like a human would at the bar, with such dedication I couldn't crush his dreams of learning how to socialize at a bar like a real boy. I realized that my waving for attention was both selfish and in vain, so I escorted myself to the front desk to request my own bill to pay and leave. Seeing places like CPK try and live beyond their station is refreshing in our modern climate of settling for "only doing the things you're skilled enough to do", no longer will America be held back my the limitations of things like competence! God Bless you CPK! I await the day you decide to try your culinary skills at other advanced foods such as microwave oatmeal.

Great location. Friendly service and not crowded even though it is not far from Union Square. The tostada pizza is exceptional (the honey oat crust also "feels" healthier). Other veggie pizzas I've tried are yummy as well; in fact everything I've tried is good. Kids meal portion sizes are filling for the kiddos as well. The bread appetizer they bring for free is also good. Overall a really good spot for families.
Horrible service! Horrible food oh wait the workers lost our orders then 50 minutes later they come back to take it again so we left. Terrible lost 50 minutes! Go to Delarosa pizza it's is amazing.

Ordered pizza from here through Doordash. Chose the spinach and artichoke pizza, and The Works pizza. Arrived after 75 minutes, cold, super dry, tasteless and very tough to chew. Will not order again.

Came here to feed the kiddos as we parents had a dinner event. We ordered strictly from the kid menu. Pizza was okay (it is in their name so it better be!). However, we made the mistake of ordering some fusilli pasta with meat sauce. Seriously, it was leftovers. It did not feel hot enough and the sauce was spotty, dry, with chunks of meat. Nothing appealing. In fact we send it back to get reheated but that clearly didn't improve it (only made it edibly hot but now ever-more dry). So, stay away.  Staff service was good but food and service comes together... The place was very cavernous but also pretty cold--I see folks keeping their jackets on (it was a rainy, windy weekend).

My friend suggested we order a pizza for pick up since we were in the area. We both had never tried it so I suggested we get the BBQ Chicken pizza. I'm a picky eater so I ordered it with chicken, cheese and BBQ sauce drizzled across the top. When we picked up the pizza it was like a personal (maybe I didn't read the online menu good enough) thank goodness I didn't have a big appetite. It tasted like it had no cheese and the crust was too crispy on the harder side. It wasn't very good to me so I didn't eat anymore after the first slice, I just let him continue to eat it. He said it was the worst pizza he's ever had so I'm pretty sure we'll both never eat here again. And people rant and rave over CPK. I just don't get it.
One of my old faves - CARNE ASADA PIZZA - it's so tasty, especially with mash! I have eaten it for like ten times already.  I can definitely recommend this place!
A great place to have a meal. The food is tasty and the service is very good.We ordered a plate that came burned, they change it and did not charge it to the bill. I recommend this place anyway.

Nothing wrong here! Went with a group from work for lunch. The avocado egg rolls were great! The full BBQ salad was at a great quality and portion. Strawberry lemonade was on point. Lastly, the BBQ Chicken pizza was delicious. Service was splendid and accommodating. Glad I chose a good spot to take my group. Unlike last night's debacle at Boulevard Cafe in Daly City. This was a refreshing experience eating from a restaurant.

My meal was what one would expect from CPK.  It wasn't stellar but it was decent, filled my belly, and didn't break the bank.  In fact, my salmon was actually cooked just right.  It seems custom now to serve overcooked salmon that makes a dull thud when it is dropped in the plate.  Our server was pretty nice too and served my wine nicely chilled.

Ordered for pick up and took 40 minutes (not in a rush to eat, so the wait wasn't a problem) Pepperoni- not good. Other pizza's on menu sound better, pizza was too bland, too plain Spicy chipotle- it was good, so my sister and husband said BBQ Chicken- it was okay, not too flavorful. More BBQ would be better and if the chicken was more seasoned that would be better. Pizza size was too small, only 6 slices per pizza and the pizza price itself was 15.99.

Everytime I come here it gets better. I really like the food and drink and not just the pizza. In fact, if you stray away from the pizza just to try other things on the menu you'll be amazed. But do have the pizza you'd like for sure because it's quite good.

I came here with two of my friends for girls night. We came here Friday night and we were seated right away. We had drinks and food all was really good. I like the sangrias and the thai chicken pizza.  The prices are reasonable you get a lot for your money.  I like this location because it is a block away from mission st and a block away from market street close to public transportation.

Let me tell you. Have you ever tried watching a warriors game in sf? I'm sure you've been to all the bars, got crowded out, felt claustrophobic, and wished you had been anywhere else. Well, that somewhere else, is this cpk. They had cheap, strong drinks, a front row seat to watch the warriors get spanked, and weird interactions amongst its bar guests. All in all, what a time.
Service was great I had the pepperoni mushroom sausage pizza and as always it was very good. The view of downtown is always a plus. Love California pizza kitchen SF.
I was here watching a basketball game. Cocktails were nice. Food was good and service was excellent.

Bad attitudes. We ordered a dessert. The waiter forgot that dessert. We asked for that dessert several times. Only did we know that the waiter forget it when he handed us a check . REALLY BAD IGNORANCE ATTITUDE . did not appreciate it

A couple of my coworkers ordered lunch from CPK last Friday, June 30th. I had picked another restaurant for my office lunch, but they were nice enough to share. Our delivery order arrived around 12 noon via Caviar. *Charred Shishito Peppers: East Asian shishito peppers pan-sautéed with soy, garlic, and red chili, Calories 220, Contains soy ($7.49) *Spinach Artichoke Dip: Served hot with housemade blue and white corn tortilla chips, Calories 930, Contains eggs, milk, soy, and wheat, May contain crustacean shellfish, fish, peanuts, and tree nuts ($11.99) *California Club Pizza: Nueske's applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken, and Mozzarella, hearth-baked then topped with wild arugula, fresh torn basil, and Romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayo, Calories 1320, Contains eggs, milk, soy, and wheat, no avocado, Substitute with Wheat Whole Grain Crust: Calories 25 ($15.99) As much as I like knowing how many calories are in the dishes I eat, I kind of think ignorance is bliss. That way, I don't feel so much like a fat a$$! But getting past the calories listed, I actually enjoyed the wheat crust on the pizza. And the salad to put on top of it. My coworker didn't use all the greens since they provided them on the side. I ended up grabbing a bunch of her leftover greens to eat with my slice of pizza. I adore shishito peppers, so they were good. Nice char and seasoned well. I found the spinach artichoke dip a little bland. Wanted to add salt and pepper to give it more flavor. I haven't to a CPK in years. Probably the last time was in Emeryville about five years ago? It was nice revisiting as I used to go to CPK a lot back in college. (There was one close to my university.) For a chain restaurant, their pizzas are still pretty good. Especially that wheat crust. Three stars overall.

This is based on our experience on 7/2/17.  We came in for early dinner & just wanted something light. It wasn't very busy or crowded when we came. My family & I ordered 4 pizzas for everyone to share. We ordered the Sicilian, Margherita, Roasted artichoke/Spinach & California Club pizzas.  It didn't take too long for our order to come- we waited for probably about 20 or so minutes. However, to our disappointment, our pizzas came cold & not hot at all.  It was as if they had been ready for some time, but were not served to us right away, as food should be served at any restaurant. We immediately notified the waitress who brought them out & she looked at us with disbelief.  She said "Hmm that's weird... it's probably because we're a little understaffed. Well I can have those reheated for you..."  Being understaffed shouldn't be an excuse as to why you're serving cold food to your customers.  The California Club pizza consisted of a salad on top of a pizza, which is understandable for why it is not served hot. The others, however, should've not been served cold. When they were brought back, the waitress seemed to have an attitude & said "Make space for me."  The pizzas were all pretty good, but it was very disappointing that they weren't served hot. Some of them were hard/over cooked after they reheated them...  It makes me wonder if we were even served freshly made-to-order pizza... Additionally, our original waiter seemed to disappear & did not check on us until later on, when we were about halfway done & to give us our check. Overall, we were quite disappointed with our experience & have never had such an experience at other CPK locations.

Our large group came in for lunch today and had a great experience. Raquel took care of us, making sure we were completely satisfied with our lunch. She made sure our waters were always filled and asked before clearing away any plates. She also made good recommendations for dishes and did this all with positive energy and a smile! The food for our group came out in a timely manner and was delicious! I couldn't have asked for a better group dining experience in the area. Thanks Raquel and we will definitely be back!

Food was great. Service was terrible the server took forever to take my order.  Then the drink came after my appetizer was done.  And then he took forever to drop the check when he finally did I tried to give him my card and he said I will be back for that in a minute and went to help a table on the front patio while I was in a rush to leave. Meanwhile the manager is just sipping on a soda behind the bar, I go to the front to pay because it's taking forever and the host makes me wait again. Was glad to get out of there, I should have noticed when several restaurants in the area had long waits on a Sunday night and they were half empty in there.
They kitchen/hostess really actually sent this out for takeout and let me leave with it? I paid $16 for this? Straight up pizza fraud!

We decided to get a quick dinner here...not much quickness. The hostess was very nice, but a joke. After seating us, we watched her text on her personal phone the entire time we were seated even when other patrons were coming and going. We watched a food delivery guy drop his bike right outside the door and proceeded to watch it get totally swooped and stolen. Another food delivery guy came in a short time later and we suggested that he lock his bike. She said she was watching it...ha...meanwhile she pulled her phone out and started texting!! I was so appalled!! The food was fine typical CPK. Our server was fine. Dinner came out slow.

Ordered a mushroom pizza and a full Caesar salad for takeout. When we got to eat it about 5 minutes later the salad was so small I could not believe I paid $14 for such a small salad. Must have been a mixup. The pizza was too salty as well and not appealing. Paid $40 at the end for a waste of my time and appetite. Should have just gone to Subway and spend $12 for two foot longs.
Nice waiter, but they use to recieve the customers with a warmer welcome, the bread and water ready immediatly, now you have to ask, poor portions. I hope they get back

The food is okay. A bit high calorie. I come here with my best friends mom here and there.  The pizza is tasty. I wouldn't recommend eating here often if you want to lose weight.  The servers are nice.  If the prices were lower and they offered more vegetarian options I would give a higher rating.
The worst service Ive ever experienced. Water took 20 minutes to get to the table. They took out the wrong order to our table. Food cold and not tasty. Avoid at all costs

This place was okay. The host was nice but the server was terrible! He even got our pizza wrong! Not sure how he might of gotten confused because our order was rather simple. It also seemed like he really hated his job. The food tasted good and the place was clean. If I could rate solely on service I would give them 0 stars. The two stars is for the taste and the place being clean.

This place is like any other CPK which is great because there's consistency in the chain. My favorite thing to get lately are the power bowls. Better than the plain salad and to be honest feels healthier because there's dark leafy greens and grains.  I got the Santa Fe power bowl (pictured) which is super tasty. Love the green cilantro lime whatever it is dressing. Love that it comes with plenty of avocados, farro, beans, corn, red cabbage, lime chicken....basically a bunch of stuff.  I normally wouldn't eat here in SF when there's plenty of other great eats in SF but I passed right by and had a gift card so thought...why not??

CPKs are everywhere so there aren't that much to write. But this one's chicken dumplings was such an disappointment! They microwaves it! It's my favorite dish here, but not sure why they microwaved the dumplings. The skin was so dry and chewy.  Lettuce wrap's lettuce wasn't that fresh. The only good dish was jambalaya.  The service here was ok, very slow, looked like they were short on staff, but our waiter was friendly.  It's the worst CPK that I have ever been to.

Glad this was right across from my hotel. I've been to a CPK and didn't remember it being this nice in the interior.  I got an arugula salad to start that was average. The real winner was the spaghetti bolognese (added mushrooms) - one of the best pasta dishes I've had in awhile. Great flavor! Really hit the spot. It was a large entree so if you're not that hungry, beware you will have leftovers. The cherry on top was the pumpkin cheesecake, a seasonal dessert with ginger crust and praline sauce. OMG so good! My dining companion and I agreed it was better than pumpkin pie and we frantically checked to see if we have a CPK in Indiana - no luck.
Can't go wrong with the kids menu cheese pizzas. You don't need to be a kid to order such, particularly if you're doing takeout. Pleasant staff.
Came in 15 minutes before closing, but they took great care of us. Food was great as well as the ate rice server Jessica.
I order postmates from here like twice a month. I love their chicken piccata.  Their bbq chicken chopped salad is good and so is the arugula asparagus salad.

TERRIBLE service!!!!  We were a party of 10 and the pastas came out first.  The server tells us that the pizzas will come out later because it takes longer.  45 minutes later, our pizzas aren't out yet and the server said it's because everyone likes pizza and it's more popular?!?!  What's the name of the restaurant?????  Pizzas came 50 minutes after our pastas and the server didn't offer us any cheese or pepper.  I've never heard that excuse at any other California Pizza Kitchen - ever!!  I will never come back here again.

Ordered door dash- hour after eating I was super sick. Totally sucks because I normally love their mushroom pizza. This time I had spaghetti bolo and the mushroom pizza but immediately I was sick! Sad to say I won't be going to this location again.  Used to eat the the Emeryville one constantly and never had an issue. Sad.

We dropped by here for a quick bite outside of our hotel. This was our third attempt at a CA Pizza Kitchen. To be quite frank- we were unimpressed. The main reason we came here was to feed our toddler some cheese pizza and though he was hungry, it only took one bite from the pizza to destroy his appetite. The pizzas here are NOT great, don't come here expecting it to be what it advertises itself as- a pizza kitchen. Rather, come for the drinks, salads and maybe, possibly the pastas (?). Overall, I would give it a 3/5 AT BEST- will not come back as it was a total waste of money and taste buds.

Surprisingly there aren't a lot of pizza options along Market Street, especially around the Westfield Mall area. We were craving pizza one day and decided to try CPK out, as I have only been to one other CPK location previously.  We arrived at around 2:30 pm, and the entire restaurant was dead. There was nobody at the hostess station to greet us, but a waiter told us to sit anywhere we wanted. Because it was before 4 pm, we were able to take advantage of the lunch special. We each got one of the specialty pizzas paired along with either soup/salad.  Pizza was good, even better than the frozen ones you find at your local supermarket frozen aisle. The caesar salad was a bit disappointing, not much flavor and the lettuce didn't taste very fresh.  Service was attentive, though it took our waiter forever to get us our check. Not the best pizza place by any means in San Francisco, but if you got a group gathering or celebration, CPK is one of the few pizza joints in Downtown SF that can cater to your needs.

My favorite dish would be the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine dish and it's horrible when they cant get it right.  I usually take all my CPK orders to-go, because the restaurant smells too much like floor chemicals.  The last time I ordered CPK, there was a thin film of oil on top of all the pasta dishes, which meant that the container wasn't the right one for the steaming hot pasta dish. I can't entirely penalize the restaurant because of packaging, but because CPK is a chain restaurant, I'd think they have a team of executives at HQ that come up with packaging details.  This place is barely packed on the weekdays and is spacious and somewhat clean. It is located right next to Office Depot tucked away on 3rd street.

Hey Y'all...I try to update when I travel, but I'm not always the greatest...anywho the food and service sucked...I ordered the chicken pesto pasta something...I'm guessing I should have just stuck with the pizza...

Initially my favorite CPK spot is in Emeryville, on Bay Street. Ate here with my family before seeing Aladdin.  Ordered the Cream Pesto Penne. It was delicious but tasted a little off. I also got a cucumber mint lemonade which I loved. One or both of those foods did not agree with my stomach. After I was done eating, I suddenly felt cramps in my stomach. We had to walk 5 blocks to the Orpheum theater, and I could most definitely not make it. We had to drive and while I was in the car, I was certain I was gonna throw up. I didn't. I also thought I was gonna get super sick during the show, out of both ends. Luckily I had medication that helped a lot. Never thought I would get food poisoning from here.

This is your standard CPK chain restaurant. The space is quite spacious, with ample seating, and a large menu. I'm a big fan of their pizzas since they have something for everybody, and the quality is good and the price is affordable. If you are looking for a super thin crispy pizza, their crispy thin crust is hard to beat. A popular appetizer would be the spinach and artichoke dip. I stopped by here twice after a long hiatus from the chain. First time was amazing, with great food and service. Food came out piping hot, and the flavors were solid. Service was attentive and friendly. Second time, not so much. This was primarily because of the poor service, that ended up trickling down into later parts of the experience, e.g. slow/no drink refills, no table bread, asked for a substitution, and waiter only got it half right. Overall 4 stars, plus or minus 1.
dam service sucks!!! it's not busy and it takes soooo long to get a drink . At. the Kapolei location.

Typical CPK, although I mistakenly expected a better version in California than the ones on the East coast. Overall, though, this was a totally satisfactory and affordable meal. We had the  flatbread, the shrimp scampi pizza, the banh mi bowl, the shrimp lettuce wraps, and the arugula asparagus salad. The pizza and the bowl were definitely the highlights, but I'd stay way from the flatbread, which was incredibly dry.  Also, great vegan options on the menu, from pizza to salads to soups, a vegan can actually get a great meal here.  Our waitress was very attentive and nice, although she did forget to bring out one dish, which we never ended up getting.  Still, a classic and enjoyable CPK dinner.
The place wasn't packed at all. The waiter wasn't very attentive. The food was mediocre. Then he got our order wrong. A waste of money. Poor service & not a way to end the night in the city.
Worst ever. I waited for 20 min and no order. When asked why, they said leave. Don't go there. Worst place

I'd give this location an overall 3.5 based on delivery. They often times burn the pizza crust but I have to say, I'm still drawn back by the thin crust pepperoni. The flavor is quite good. While there are many other better places, pizza-wise, I do think this CPK is a little more than decent.
Food was excellent, service was excellent. We had a group of 18, half were kids. We understand this was not an easy table to serve. Josh ( server) did an excellent job!
